This approach gives us only k+1 samples from f ε
V
. To obtain a larger number of samples which are well-dispersed, we add to f ε
V
realizations from an independent bivariate normal distribution with standard deviations in each dimension set to 1/5 of the original k+1 sample ranges. We use the value of 1/5 because it results in samples with a reasonably smooth density that preserve s large scale cross-correlation structure between the original k+1 samples of ε
σ and ε
ρ , and provides a decent approximation to the underlying pdf for f ε
V
(Fig A in S1 File). Sensitivity tests indicate that using lower standard deviations can degrade the smoothness of the pdf (not shown).
